nodes.text: An e-nursery retail website that integrates clustering-based recommendation and visual data representation will enhance user experience and optimize business operations for plant nurseries and customers
A recommendation system that groups users by similar preferences and behaviors using clustering algorithms can provide personalized product suggestions
Visual data representation (dashboards, charts) provides stakeholders with intuitive insights into sales trends, customer demographics, and product popularity to inform decisions
Collecting plant database attributes, customer registrations, purchase and search history, and product feedback is necessary input data for clustering and visualization
Implementing e-commerce features (secure payment gateway, add-to-cart, checkout, user registration, login, product pages) is required to operationalize the e-nursery platform
Clustering algorithms such as K-means or hierarchical clustering can be used to group users and generate recommendations based on cluster membership
Data preparation steps include cleaning and formatting customer data, purchase history, and search logs before applying clustering
Recommendation generation maps a user's cluster to popular or relevant products within that cluster to suggest items aligned with prior purchases and interests
Connecting the project database to visualization tools (Tableau, Matplotlib) and designing interactive dashboards enables exploration via filters and drill-downs
Visual dashboards improve accessibility of complex project data, aiding stakeholders in inventory management, marketing strategy, and communicating insights
Implemented system example: when a user added Piper Betel Maghal, the recommendation module suggested Aloe vera, demonstrating personalized suggestions in the prototype
Prototype website includes login, registration, home page, add-to-cart, checkout, payment gateway integration, payment receipt, and recommendation pages as GUI outputs
Prior literature supports clustering and hybrid recommendation approaches as effective for improving recommendation accuracy and addressing cold-start and sparsity issues
Limitations include potential constraints from data availability and algorithm parameters that can affect recommendation accuracy and require tuning

Conclusion: Integrating clustering algorithms and visual data representation in an e-nursery platform creates a user-friendly, data-driven system that can enhance shopping experience, drive engagement, and support business decisions, while requiring careful data preparation and algorithm tuning
